item.title: Designating a week as "Extension Living Well Week".

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation, Credit, Rural Development and Research.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5095)

summary.text:
Designates the second week of March 2005 as Extension Living Well Week.

Encourages the people of the United States to take advantage of the educational opportunities that Extension Family and Consumer Sciences educators provide.

bill.title: A concurrent resolution designating the second week of March 2005 as "Extension Living Well Week".

item.title: A concurrent resolution designating the second week of March 2005 as "Extension Living Well Week".
A concurrent resolution designating the second week of March 2005 as "Extension Living Well Week".

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5095)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
